DataElement.preferredName: Ampulla of Vater Adenocarcinoma with Peculiar Aspect Histotype Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Name for the subtype used to refine a diagnosis of Ampulla of Vater Cancer adenocarcinoma with peculiar aspects.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ampulla of Vater Adenocarcinoma With Unusual Aspect Histologic Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An invasive carcinoma with glandular differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Signs and symptoms include jaundice, abdominal pain, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, and weight loss._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._Out of the ordinary, uncommon, or unexpected._A characteristic to be considered; a distinct feature or element._Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An invasive carcinoma with glandular differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Signs and symptoms include jaundice, abdominal pain, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, and weight loss.

Concepts.definition: An invasive carcinoma with glandular differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Signs and symptoms include jaundice, abdominal pain, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, and weight loss.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:Out of the ordinary, uncommon, or unexpected.:A characteristic to be considered; a distinct feature or element.:Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Out of the ordinary, uncommon, or unexpected.
A characteristic to be considered; a distinct feature or element.
Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Curation request for Ampulla of Vater Cancer 5.16.18 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Mixed Neoplasm Ampulla of Vater Adenocarcinoma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Mixed Neoplasm Ampulla of Vater Adenocarcinoma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of at least two distinct cellular populations.: An invasive carcinoma with glandular differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Signs and symptoms include jaundice, abdominal pain, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, and weight loss.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of at least two distinct cellular populations.
An invasive carcinoma with glandular differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Signs and symptoms include jaundice, abdominal pain, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, and weight loss.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An invasive adenocarcinoma arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of intestinal-type malignant epithelial cells.

Concepts.definition: An invasive adenocarcinoma arising from the ampulla of Vater. Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of intestinal-type malignant epithelial cells.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Ampulla of Vater Pancreatobiliary Type Adenocarcinoma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Ampulla of Vater Pancreatobiliary Type Adenocarcinoma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An invasive adenocarcinoma that arises from the ampulla of Vater. It is characterized by the presence of malignant cells that resemble the malignant cells of the pancreatic ductal or extrahepatic bile duct carcinomas.

Concepts.longName: Ampulla of Vater Pancreatobiliary Type Adenocarcinoma
Concepts.definition: An invasive adenocarcinoma that arises from the ampulla of Vater. It is characterized by the presence of malignant cells that resemble the malignant cells of the pancreatic ductal or extrahepatic bile duct carcinomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma with glandular and squamous differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Signs and symptoms include jaundice, abdominal pain, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, and weight loss.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma with glandular and squamous differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater. Signs and symptoms include jaundice, abdominal pain, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, and weight loss.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Ampulla of Vater Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Ampulla of Vater Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of mucin-containing signet-ring cells.

Concepts.longName: Ampulla of Vater Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma
Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of mucin-containing signet-ring cells.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Ampulla of Vater Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Ampulla of Vater Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma with glandular differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of glycogen-rich cells with hyperchromatic nuclei.

Concepts.longName: Ampulla of Vater Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma
Concepts.definition: A carcinoma with glandular differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of glycogen-rich cells with hyperchromatic nuclei.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma with glandular differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of mucoid stroma formation.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma with glandular differentiation arising from the ampulla of Vater.  Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of mucoid stroma formation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
